content.question: Two thin rings are spinning counterclockwise about an axis perpendicular to the rings’ centers. Ring <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="lowercase m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and radius <math alttext="lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math>, while Ring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has mass <math alttext="lowercase m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and radius <math alttext="4 lowercase r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mi>r</mi></math>. Identical counterclockwise torques are exerted on each ring. The rotational inertia of a ring of mass <math alttext="uppercase M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> and radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> is <math alttext="I sub ring equals uppercase M uppercase R squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mtext>ring</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>M</mi><msup><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. Which of the following correctly relates <math alttext="alpha sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, the angular acceleration of Ring <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Ring <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="alpha sub 1 equals the fraction alpha sub 2 over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>
<math alttext="alpha sub 1 equals alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="alpha sub 1 equals 4 alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="alpha sub 1 equals 16 alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="alpha sub 1 equals 16 alpha sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>16</mn><msub><mi>α</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
